revised_title: The Effect of Trace Element Additions on Grain Boundary Composition of Ir + 0.3% W Alloys
tldr: This study investigates the impact of trace element additions on the grain boundary composition of Ir + 0.3% W alloys. The research focuses on the effect of impurities and dopants on the material properties, particularly the grain boundaries. The results indicate that certain elements can significantly affect the overall elongation rate and the material's resistance to intergranular failure.
